description: SeekOut, a Seattle-area startup that sells recruiting software and raised $115 million in 2022, is trimming its workforce for the second time in the past eight months. TechCrunch, which first reported on the layoffs, reported that 30% of SeekOut’s workforce was let go. The cuts were announced last week, according to LinkedIn posts from affected workers. We’ve reached out to the company for comment. SeekOut previously laid off 7% of its staff in October, and said it had about 200 employees at the time. Founded in 2017, SeekOut’s software is used by more than 1,000 companies to help with recruiting.… Read More
title: Recruiting software company SeekOut lays off employees in another round of cuts

description: New research suggests that using robots to address workers shortages in hospitality jobs such as food service and hotel work could create a negative feedback loop that makes the problem worse. A survey of 321 lodging and 308 food service employees in the U.S. found that the fear of robots replacing human workers increased their job insecurity and stress — which heightened intentions of resigning. The anxiety and likelihood of quitting was most pronounced among workers who had experience working with robotic technologies. The concerns applied to low-level employees and managers alike. “The turnover rate in the hospitality industry ranks… Read More
title: Do robots harm or help hospitality labor shortages? New research warns of worker anxieties

description: Manifold Freight, a new Seattle-based trucking software startup aiming to help aggregate spot freight opportunities for carriers, raised a $1.9 million seed round. Previously: Former Convoy engineers take another swing at trucking tech with new Seattle startup
title: YC grad Manifold Freight raises $1.9M for trucking logistics software

description: WeWork plans to hold onto five more of its co-working spaces — bringing the total to 10 — in the Seattle area as part of its effort to renegotiate leases worldwide during its bankruptcy-related restructuring.
title: WeWork plans to hold onto five more co-working spaces in Seattle area

description: REDMOND, Wash. — Microsoft showed new integrations between its Copilot artificial intelligence technologies and its Windows PC operating system, and previewed a new class of personal computers designed to further build AI capabilities into its longtime software platform. “We believe AI will be distributed,” Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said at a media event here Monday morning in advance of the company’s Build developer conference in Seattle this week. “The richest AI experiences will harness the power of the cloud and the edge working together in concert.” Microsoft is calling the initiative “Copilot + PC,” leveraging advanced neural processing units (NPUs)…
title: Microsoft unveils new ‘Copilot + PC’ initiative in new bid to revitalize Windows with AI

description: A hot Seattle startup developing autonomous driving technology for off-road vehicles announced a $10 million seed round to fuel its growth. It’s the latest milestone for Overland AI, the University of Washington spinout aiming to help companies — and the U.S. military — use ground vehicles in complex terrain without the need for a human driver. Last month Overland announced that it won a two-year contract worth up to $18.6 million with the U.S. Army and Defense Innovation Unit to develop its OverDrive technology platform for the U.S. Army’s Robotic Combat Vehicle. “Our mission is to eliminate risk to humans by… Read More
title: UW spinout Overland AI raises $10M for off-road self-driving tech used by U.S. military
